Class Rule

java.lang.Object
Rule
public class Rule
extends java.lang.Object
This class represents any one of the 256 possible rules that govern the evolution of ECAs. The class has methods that take the cell states of an ECA at one time and return the states after the next time step.
Version:
0.1
Author:
Rebekah Lee

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Rule​(int ruleNum)
    Create a Rule corresponding to the given Wolfram code.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean evolve​(boolean[] neighborhood)
    Return the next state of a cell with the given neighborhood of states.
    Generation evolve​(Generation gen)
    Apply the rule to the given Generation and return the next Generation.
    static boolean[] getNeighborhood​(int idx, Generation gen)
    Return the state of the cell with the given index in the given Generation along with the states of its two nearest neighbors.
    int getRuleNum()
    Return the rule's Wolfram code.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

  • Constructor Details

    • Rule

      public Rule​(int ruleNum)
      Create a Rule corresponding to the given Wolfram code. If ruleNum is less than 0 or greater than 255, use the closest valid rule number instead.
      Parameters:
      ruleNum - is the number of possible rules.

  • Method Details

    • evolve

      public Generation evolve​(Generation gen)
      Apply the rule to the given Generation and return the next Generation.
      Parameters:
      gen - the Generation.
      Returns:
      the next Generation.

    • evolve

      public boolean evolve​(boolean[] neighborhood)
      Return the next state of a cell with the given neighborhood of states. The input is an array that contains the states of the left neighbor, the cell itself, and the right neighbor (in that order).
      Parameters:
      neighborhood - is the surrounding cell.
      Returns:
      the next state of a cell.

    • getNeighborhood

      public static boolean[] getNeighborhood​(int idx, Generation gen)
      Return the state of the cell with the given index in the given Generation along with the states of its two nearest neighbors. If the index corresponds to the first or last cell, use circular boundary conditions to get the state of its left or right neighbor.
      Parameters:
      idx - is the given index.
      gen - is the given Generation.
      Returns:
      boolean array of states.

    • getRuleNum

      public int getRuleNum()
      Return the rule's Wolfram code.
      Returns:
      the rule number.
